about.title: About me
paragraphs: Hi, I'm Alejandro Segovia, graduated in Computer Engineering from the University of CÃ¡diz. Since 2018, I have been working as a software developer, specializing in frontend development.

I have worked on very diverse projects, from small websites for SMEs to international systems in sectors such as banking, logistics, and e-commerce. Each project allowed me to learn and quickly adapt to new technologies and challenges.
I consider myself curious and proactive: I love discussing which solutions are better and why, sharing ideas with colleagues, and I believe sharing knowledge is the best way to learn.
I enjoy facing challenges I haven't tackled yet. I believe that the unknown is where you learn the most and where you can make a real difference.

jobs.description: Designed and implemented web tools for comprehensive budget and external logistics (3PL) management using React & Node.
Designed SPAs and international mobile applications using Express, Angular, React, and React Native. Collaborated in agile teams following Scrum methodologies.
Designed and implemented corporate websites using HTML, CSS, JavaScript & PHP. Maintained and updated content.

list.title: Clean Arch Frontend
list.description: A project to demonstrate clean architecture implementation in the frontend with a React app where simple events can be managed, switching the data source from HTTP to LocalStorage without changing business or presentation logic.

list.title: MFE Module Federation
list.description: Micro Frontend with Webpack Module Federation. Project demonstrating how to integrate multiple independent microfrontends into a single host container allowing cross-MFE communication.

list.title: Mutation Testing
list.description: Application demonstrating the use of Stryker as a Mutation Testing tool in a TypeScript project with Jest and Testing Library.
